18#include "PDFDetector.h"
19#include "BinaryBitmap.h"
20#include "DecodeStatus.h"
21#include "BitMatrix.h"
22#include "ZXNullable.h"

24#include <algorithm>
25#include <array>
26#include <cstdlib>
27#include <limits>
28#include <list>
29#include <vector>
30
31namespace ZXing {
32namespace Pdf417 {
33
34static const int INDEXES_START_PATTERN[] = { 0, 4, 1, 5 };
35static const int INDEXES_STOP_PATTERN[] = { 6, 2, 7, 3 };
36static const float MAX_AVG_VARIANCE = 0.42f;
37static const float MAX_INDIVIDUAL_VARIANCE = 0.8f;
38
39// B S B S B S B S Bar/Space pattern
40// 11111111 0 1 0 1 0 1 000
41static const std::vector<int> START_PATTERN = { 8, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 3 };
42// 1111111 0 1 000 1 0 1 00 1
43static const std::vector<int> STOP_PATTERN = { 7, 1, 1, 3, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1 };
44static const int MAX_PIXEL_DRIFT = 3;
45static const int MAX_PATTERN_DRIFT = 5;
46// if we set the value too low, then we don't detect the correct height of the bar if the start patterns are damaged.
47// if we set the value too high, then we might detect the start pattern from a neighbor barcode.
48static const int SKIPPED_ROW_COUNT_MAX = 25;
49// A PDF471 barcode should have at least 3 rows, with each row being >= 3 times the module width. Therefore it should be at least
50// 9 pixels tall. To be conservative, we use about half the size to ensure we don't miss it.
51static const int ROW_STEP = 5;
52static const int BARCODE_MIN_HEIGHT = 10;
53
54/**
55* Determines how closely a set of observed counts of runs of black/white
56* values matches a given target pattern. This is reported as the ratio of
57* the total variance from the expected pattern proportions across all
58* pattern elements, to the length of the pattern.
59*
60* @param counters observed counters
61* @param pattern expected pattern
62* @param maxIndividualVariance The most any counter can differ before we give up
63* @return ratio of total variance between counters and pattern compared to total pattern size
64*/
65static float
66PatternMatchVariance(const std::vector<int>& counters, const std::vector<int>& pattern, float maxIndividualVariance)
67{
68 int total = 0;
69 int patternLength = 0;
70 for (size_t i = 0; i < counters.size(); i++) {
71 total += counters[i];
72 patternLength += pattern[i];
73 }
74 if (total < patternLength) {
75 // If we don't even have one pixel per unit of bar width, assume this
76 // is too small to reliably match, so fail:
77 return std::numeric_limits<float>::max();
78 }
79 // We're going to fake floating-point math in integers. We just need to use more bits.
80 // Scale up patternLength so that intermediate values below like scaledCounter will have
81 // more "significant digits".
82 float unitBarWidth = (float)total / patternLength;
83 maxIndividualVariance *= unitBarWidth;
84
85 float totalVariance = 0.0f;
86 for (size_t x = 0; x < counters.size(); x++) {
87 int counter = counters[x];
88 float scaledPattern = pattern[x] * unitBarWidth;
89 float variance = counter > scaledPattern ? counter - scaledPattern : scaledPattern - counter;
90 if (variance > maxIndividualVariance) {
91 return std::numeric_limits<float>::max();
92 }
93 totalVariance += variance;
94 }
95 return totalVariance / total;
96}
97
98
99/**
100* @param matrix row of black/white values to search
101* @param column x position to start search
102* @param row y position to start search
103* @param width the number of pixels to search on this row
104* @param pattern pattern of counts of number of black and white pixels that are
105* being searched for as a pattern
106* @param counters array of counters, as long as pattern, to re-use
107* @return start/end horizontal offset of guard pattern, as an array of two ints.
108*/
109static bool
110FindGuardPattern(const BitMatrix& matrix, int column, int row, int width, bool whiteFirst, const std::vector<int>& pattern, std::vector<int>& counters, int& startPos, int& endPos)
111{
112 std::fill(counters.begin(), counters.end(), 0);
113 int patternLength = Size(pattern);
114 bool isWhite = whiteFirst;
115 int patternStart = column;
116 int pixelDrift = 0;
117
118 // if there are black pixels left of the current pixel shift to the left, but only for MAX_PIXEL_DRIFT pixels
119 while (matrix.get(patternStart, row) && patternStart > 0 && pixelDrift++ < MAX_PIXEL_DRIFT) {
120 patternStart--;
121 }
122 int x = patternStart;
123 int counterPosition = 0;
124 for (; x < width; x++) {
125 bool pixel = matrix.get(x, row);
126 if (pixel != isWhite) {
127 counters[counterPosition]++;
128 }
129 else {
130 if (counterPosition == patternLength - 1) {
131 if (PatternMatchVariance(counters, pattern, MAX_INDIVIDUAL_VARIANCE) < MAX_AVG_VARIANCE) {
132 startPos = patternStart;
133 endPos = x;
134 return true;
135 }
136 patternStart += counters[0] + counters[1];
137 std::copy(counters.begin() + 2, counters.end(), counters.begin());
138 counters[patternLength - 2] = 0;
139 counters[patternLength - 1] = 0;
140 counterPosition--;
141 }
142 else {
143 counterPosition++;
144 }
145 counters[counterPosition] = 1;
146 isWhite = !isWhite;
147 }
148 }
149 if (counterPosition == patternLength - 1) {
150 if (PatternMatchVariance(counters, pattern, MAX_INDIVIDUAL_VARIANCE) < MAX_AVG_VARIANCE) {
151 startPos = patternStart;
152 endPos = x - 1;
153 return true;
154 }
155 }
156 return false;
157}
158
159static std::array<Nullable<ResultPoint>, 4>&
160FindRowsWithPattern(const BitMatrix& matrix, int height, int width, int startRow, int startColumn, const std::vector<int>& pattern, std::array<Nullable<ResultPoint>, 4>& result)
161{
162 bool found = false;
163 int startPos, endPos;
164 std::vector<int> counters(pattern.size(), 0);
165 for (; startRow < height; startRow += ROW_STEP) {
166 if (FindGuardPattern(matrix, startColumn, startRow, width, false, pattern, counters, startPos, endPos)) {
167 while (startRow > 0) {
168 if (!FindGuardPattern(matrix, startColumn, --startRow, width, false, pattern, counters, startPos, endPos)) {
169 startRow++;
170 break;
171 }
172 }
173 result[0] = ResultPoint(startPos, startRow);
174 result[1] = ResultPoint(endPos, startRow);
175 found = true;
176 break;
177 }
178 }
179 int stopRow = startRow + 1;
180 // Last row of the current symbol that contains pattern
181 if (found) {
182 int skippedRowCount = 0;
183 int previousRowStart = static_cast<int>(result[0].value().x());
184 int previousRowEnd = static_cast<int>(result[1].value().x());
185 for (; stopRow < height; stopRow++) {
186 int startPos, endPos;
187 found = FindGuardPattern(matrix, previousRowStart, stopRow, width, false, pattern, counters, startPos, endPos);
188 // a found pattern is only considered to belong to the same barcode if the start and end positions
189 // don't differ too much. Pattern drift should be not bigger than two for consecutive rows. With
190 // a higher number of skipped rows drift could be larger. To keep it simple for now, we allow a slightly
191 // larger drift and don't check for skipped rows.
192 if (found && std::abs(previousRowStart - startPos) < MAX_PATTERN_DRIFT && std::abs(previousRowEnd - endPos) < MAX_PATTERN_DRIFT) {
193 previousRowStart = startPos;
194 previousRowEnd = endPos;
195 skippedRowCount = 0;
196 }
197 else if (skippedRowCount > SKIPPED_ROW_COUNT_MAX) {
198 break;
199 }
200 else {
201 skippedRowCount++;
202 }
203 }
204 stopRow -= skippedRowCount + 1;
205 result[2] = ResultPoint(previousRowStart, stopRow);
206 result[3] = ResultPoint(previousRowEnd, stopRow);
207 }
208 if (stopRow - startRow < BARCODE_MIN_HEIGHT) {
209 std::fill(result.begin(), result.end(), nullptr);
210 }
211 return result;
212}
213
214static void
215CopyToResult(std::array<Nullable<ResultPoint>, 8>& result, const std::array<Nullable<ResultPoint>, 4>& tmpResult, const int destinationIndexes[4])
216{
217 for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
218 result[destinationIndexes[i]] = tmpResult[i];
219 }
220}
221
222/**
223* Locate the vertices and the codewords area of a black blob using the Start
224* and Stop patterns as locators.
225*
226* @param matrix the scanned barcode image.
227* @return an array containing the vertices:
228* vertices[0] x, y top left barcode
229* vertices[1] x, y bottom left barcode
230* vertices[2] x, y top right barcode
231* vertices[3] x, y bottom right barcode
232* vertices[4] x, y top left codeword area
233* vertices[5] x, y bottom left codeword area
234* vertices[6] x, y top right codeword area
235* vertices[7] x, y bottom right codeword area
236*/
237static std::array<Nullable<ResultPoint>, 8> FindVertices(const BitMatrix& matrix, int startRow, int startColumn)
238{
239 int width = matrix.width();
240 int height = matrix.height();
241
242 std::array<Nullable<ResultPoint>, 4> tmp;
243 std::array<Nullable<ResultPoint>, 8> result;
244 CopyToResult(result, FindRowsWithPattern(matrix, height, width, startRow, startColumn, START_PATTERN, tmp), INDEXES_START_PATTERN);
245
246 if (result[4] != nullptr) {
247 startColumn = static_cast<int>(result[4].value().x());
248 startRow = static_cast<int>(result[4].value().y());
249 }
250 CopyToResult(result, FindRowsWithPattern(matrix, height, width, startRow, startColumn, STOP_PATTERN, tmp), INDEXES_STOP_PATTERN);
251 return result;
252}
253
254/**
255* Detects PDF417 codes in an image. Only checks 0 degree rotation
256* @param multiple if true, then the image is searched for multiple codes. If false, then at most one code will
257* be found and returned
258* @param bitMatrix bit matrix to detect barcodes in
259* @return List of ResultPoint arrays containing the coordinates of found barcodes
260*/
261static std::list<std::array<Nullable<ResultPoint>, 8>> DetectBarcode(const BitMatrix& bitMatrix, bool multiple)
262{
263 int row = 0;
264 int column = 0;
265 bool foundBarcodeInRow = false;
266 std::list<std::array<Nullable<ResultPoint>, 8>> barcodeCoordinates;
267
268 while (row < bitMatrix.height()) {
269 auto vertices = FindVertices(bitMatrix, row, column);
270
271 if (vertices[0] == nullptr && vertices[3] == nullptr) {
272 if (!foundBarcodeInRow) {
273 // we didn't find any barcode so that's the end of searching
274 break;
275 }
276 // we didn't find a barcode starting at the given column and row. Try again from the first column and slightly
277 // below the lowest barcode we found so far.
278 foundBarcodeInRow = false;
279 column = 0;
280 for (auto& barcodeCoordinate : barcodeCoordinates) {
281 if (barcodeCoordinate[1] != nullptr) {
282 row = std::max(row, static_cast<int>(barcodeCoordinate[1].value().y()));
283 }
284 if (barcodeCoordinate[3] != nullptr) {
285 row = std::max(row, static_cast<int>(barcodeCoordinate[3].value().y()));
286 }
287 }
288 row += ROW_STEP;
289 continue;
290 }
291 foundBarcodeInRow = true;
292 barcodeCoordinates.push_back(vertices);
293 if (!multiple) {
294 break;
295 }
296 // if we didn't find a right row indicator column, then continue the search for the next barcode after the
297 // start pattern of the barcode just found.
298 if (vertices[2] != nullptr) {
299 column = static_cast<int>(vertices[2].value().x());
300 row = static_cast<int>(vertices[2].value().y());
301 }
302 else {
303 column = static_cast<int>(vertices[4].value().x());
304 row = static_cast<int>(vertices[4].value().y());
305 }
306 }
307 return barcodeCoordinates;
308}
309
310
311/**
312* <p>Detects a PDF417 Code in an image. Only checks 0 and 180 degree rotations.</p>
313*
314* @param image barcode image to decode
315* @param hints optional hints to detector
316* @param multiple if true, then the image is searched for multiple codes. If false, then at most one code will
317* be found and returned
318* @return {@link PDF417DetectorResult} encapsulating results of detecting a PDF417 code
319* @throws NotFoundException if no PDF417 Code can be found
320*/
321DecodeStatus
322Detector::Detect(const BinaryBitmap& image, bool multiple, Result& result)
323{
324 // TODO detection improvement, tryHarder could try several different luminance thresholds/blackpoints or even
325 // different binarizers
326 //boolean tryHarder = hints != null && hints.containsKey(DecodeHintType.TRY_HARDER);
327
328 auto binImg = image.getBlackMatrix();
329 if (binImg == nullptr) {
330 return DecodeStatus::NotFound;
331 }
332
333 auto barcodeCoordinates = DetectBarcode(*binImg, multiple);
334 if (barcodeCoordinates.empty()) {
335 auto newBits = std::make_shared<BitMatrix>(binImg->copy());
336 newBits->rotate180();
337 binImg = newBits;
338 barcodeCoordinates = DetectBarcode(*binImg, multiple);
339 }
340 if (barcodeCoordinates.empty()) {
341 return DecodeStatus::NotFound;
342 }
343 result.points = barcodeCoordinates;
344 result.bits = binImg;
345 return DecodeStatus::NoError;
346}
347
